title: How to notice that jungle items are poorly designed:
body:
The vast majority of jungler upgrades smite, but skips the jungle item for something useful. The only enchantment worth an item slot is warrior.

Jungle items maybe cost efficient, but ironically they're useless in the jungle. There are better choices.

- MR items were nerfed, Mercs are a must buy on tanks anway. Why waste money on a doubled stat?
- Magus doesn't help with mana sustain and simply delays an actually useful item like Rylais, Liandry's or Morellonomnicon.
- Devourer was nerfed incredibly hard. Most AD'lers are better off with Warrior. Jungler's like Lulu or TF are not viable anymore (after nerfs to this item) anyways.

----------------
Please Riot. Do something about these horrible items.

**You could at least start by adding increased health and especially mana regeneration to compensate for the more durable monsters.**

replies.body: I agree, Why can't we get Spirit stone back, and have it build into a tanky item?
I'd argue that NEEDING to rush a jungle item is just a sign that's it's overpowered.

A jungle item is called a jungle item because it's supposed to help you doign your job - in the jungle.

Just like Spirit Stone and Madrads Razor did last season. Where these items horribly op? No. they just helped you to do your job. Which the current "jungle items" do worse than non jungle items.

Ironically enough - the current jungle items would make good lane items, but they're horrible for jungling.

I got {{item:3160}} every single time I jungled last season. Why? Cause it was OP.

This season is about taking back what they did last season. It's about making junglers less of the safest way to carry, killing the Godyr effect.  The jungle items aren't OP, and that's okay.

So why did so many people - also at tournaments - purchase the alternative? Spirit Stone Upgrades?

just because an item is strong on certain champs doesn't make it OP.

Otherwise these had to be nerfed as well:
{{item:3153}} {{item:3031}} {{item:3035}} {{item:3135}} {{item:3089}} {{item:3128}} {{item:3157}} {{item:3087}} {{item:3006}} {{item:3111}} {{item:3117}} {{item:3042}} {{item:3143}} {{item:3074}} {{item:2049}} {{item:3401}} {{item:3151}} {{item:3078}} {{item:3069}} {{item:3222}} 

Shall I continue the list?
All items support their dedicated role.
Be it ADC-dps, money generation and support or simply the ability to burst your target as an AP-mid.

Jungle items are supposed to help you while jungling, allowing to jungle better than a character without this item. What's wrong if the item is actually good at it#s dedicated role?

Hydra and FotM aren't strong. And as for the rest, I don't really think it's a case of them being OP as much as everything else not being to standard. Sometimes that's justified in its cost, but usually it's not. And also, for something to be considered overpowered, it can't really have an equivalent that could work equally well. All of the items listed (that don't suck) have a  counterpart that can effectively replace their spot.

Also, let's be clear that you're complaining about the enchantments to the jungle items. not the jungle items themselves. The jungle items are very useful. They aren't very strong, but they're designed to be accompanied with an enchantment *eventually*. There's nothing wrong with rushing them, and there's nothing wrong with not rushing them. There WOULD be something wrong if something had to be rushed almost every game, almost every time. See trailblazer+devourer 4.20 patch.

Edit: Except sightstone, which was an odd choice to include in your list.

{{item:3074}} ... not strong? :X sorry that I'm focussing on this - but did you ever play {{champion:421}} {{champion:114}} {{champion:107}} {{champion:121}} ? this item makes freaking beasts out of them (well, most of them already are beasts, but you know what i mean)
Mm, yeah. I used to rush Hydra on Fi. Then I discovered what triforce is. Js.

I don't mean to be rude... but if you're not rushing {{item:3074}}  on {{champion:114}}  and its not because you're against an ap in lane and have to rush {{item:3155}} instead.... you're doing something wrong.

{{item:3074}}  is literally core first item on {{champion:114}} , like... this isn't a debate. The fact that blade waltz procs tiamat each time it hits and and provides fiora with excellent wave clear makes it literally the perfect item for her.... JS
She doesn't actually need wave clear. She's a melee carry. She clears quickly just with her kit.

Okay

Good things about new jungle items: More meaningful choices by virtue of smite options; the ability to get stats suited to your champion combined with a smite suited to your playstyle.

Bad things about new jungle items: Decreased sustain, particularly for mana users, unless you choose {{item:3713}}; stats on enchantments ranging from "generally pretty sweet" to "meh, I may buy it later."

Overall, they are definitely a change in the positive direction, the only real thing is that the enchatment stats need to be retuned in some areas, which will happen as time goes on. It may take some time due to the absolutely massive overhaul of multiple systems (jungle itemization and the jungle itself), but I can see what riot is going for with the majority of the changes, and once they are better tuned for the overall gamestate, I think they'll be clear improvements from the old items.
